tit.cmt: 後段で詳しく説明されていますので括弧内説明ははぶきます。「一本だたら」と後段で何度も出てきてややこしいので一語として扱います。

sen.j: 一本だたら、一本踏鞴（いっぽんだたら）とは、日本に伝わる妖怪の一種で、熊野（和歌山県）の山中などに棲む。
sen.e: Ippon-datara is a kind of Japanese specter, live in the mountains of Kumano (Wakayama Prefecture) and other areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Ippon-datara is a specter of Japan, living in the mountains of Kumano (Wakayama Prefecture) and other areas.
Ippon-datara is a specter of Japan, living in the mountains of Kumano (Wakayama Prefecture) and other areas.

sen.j: 一つ目で一本足の姿をしている。
sen.e: It has one eye and one leg.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It has one eye and one leg.
It has one eye and one leg.

sen.j: 和歌山と奈良県の境の果無山脈では12月20日のみ現れるという。
sen.e: In Kamu mountain range which is the boundary of Wakayama Prefecture and Nara Prefecture, it allegedly appears only on December 20.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Hatenashi mountain range which is the boundary of Wakayama Prefecture and Nara Prefecture, it allegedly appears only on December 20.
sen.cmt: オリジナルに「華無山脈」とありましたが、「果無」の間違いなので直します。
sen.e: In Hatenashi mountain range which is the boundary of Wakayama Prefecture and Nara Prefecture, it allegedly appears only on December 20.

sen.j: この日は「果ての二十日」と呼ばれて厄日とされた。
sen.e: The day is called "hate no hatsuka" (bad 20th day) and considered as an evil day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The day has been called 'Hate no Hatsuka' (20th day of the end) and considered as an evil day.
The day has been called 'Hate no Hatsuka' (20th day of the end) and considered as an evil day.

sen.j: 華無の名の由来は「果ての二十日」に人通りが無くなるからだともいう。
sen.e: Some say that it is called Kamu because the area is deserted on "hate no hatsuka."
Someone says that the mountain range's name 'Hatenashi' (no end) originated from 'Hate no Hatsuka' on which nobody had gone into the mountains.
Someone says that the mountain range's name 'Hatenashi' (no end) originated from 'Hate no Hatsuka' on which nobody had gone into the mountains.

sen.j: 奈良県の伯母ヶ峰山でも同様に、12月20日に山中に入ると一本だたらに遭うという。
sen.e: Likewise, it is said that you may encounter Ippon datara in Mt. Obagamine on December 20.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Likewise, it has been said that if a person goes into Mt. Obagamine on December 20, he/she would encounter Ippon-datara.
Likewise, it has been said that if a person goes into Mt. Obagamine on December 20, he/she would encounter Ippon-datara.

sen.j: この日は山に入らないよう戒められている。
sen.e: It is advised not to enter the mountain on that day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is advised not to enter the mountain on that day.
It is advised not to enter the mountain on that day.

sen.j: こちらの一本だたらは電柱に目鼻をつけたような姿という。
sen.e: The ippon datara here is allegedly like a telephone pole with eyes and nose.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In this area, Ippon-datara has been considered to be like a telephone pole with an eye (or eyes) and a nose.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくします。前段に一つ目とありますので念のため一つ目を先にして加えておきます。
sen.e: In this area, Ippon-datara has been considered to be like a telephone pole with an eye (or eyes) and a nose.

sen.j: さらに雪の日に宙返りしながら一本足の足跡を残すという。
sen.e: It is also said that the specter leaves the footprint of one leg, looping the loops on a snowy day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is also said that the specter leaves footprints of one leg, looping the loops on a snowy day.
sen.cmt: 足跡は二つ以上残すのだと思います。
sen.e: It is also said that the specter leaves footprints of one leg, looping the loops on a snowy day.

sen.j: また伯母ヶ峰山の一本だたらは、猪笹王（いのささおう）というイノシシの霊が化けた鬼神を指すこともある。
sen.e: Moreover, ippon datara of Mt. Obagamine may refer to a fierce god called King Inosasa, which is transformed from spirit of a wild boar.
Moreover, Ippon-datara of Mt. Obagamine sometimes refers to a fierce god called Inosasa-o (King Inosasa) which is transformed from the spirit of a wild boar.
sen.cmt: スタイルを統一します。
sen.e: Moreover, Ippon-datara of Mt. Obagamine sometimes refers to a fierce god called Inosasa-o (King Inosasa) which is transformed from the spirit of a wild boar.

sen.j: 猪笹王は旅人を食い殺して人々から恐れられていた。
sen.e: King Inosasa terrified people for biting the travelers to death.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Inosasa-o had been terrifing people for eating travelers.
sen.cmt: 食い殺すはただのeatです。
sen.e: Inosasa-o had been terrifing people for eating travelers.

sen.j: ある高僧が地蔵を勧請したことでこの凶行は止んだ。
sen.e: This savage act stopped when a high priest did kanjo (praying for the coming of a deity) for Jizo (guardian deity of children).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, after a high priest did kanjo (praying for a coming of a deity), Inosasa-o gave up such acts of appalling cruelty.
However, after a high priest did kanjo (praying for a coming of a deity), Inosasa-o gave up such acts of appalling cruelty.

sen.j: しかし年に一度、12月20日だけは猪笹王が自由になるのだという。
sen.e: However, it is said that King Inosasa becomes free once a year, on December 20.
However, it is said that Inosasa-o becomes free once a year, on December 20.
However, it is said that Inosasa-o becomes free once a year, on December 20.

sen.j: 人間を襲うという伝承が多いが、なぜか郵便屋だけは襲わないといわれる。
sen.e: Although there are many legends of attacking people, it is said that it never attacks a mailman for unknown reason.
Although there are many legends that Ippon-datara attacks people, it is said that it never attacks a mailman for unknown reasons.
Although there are many legends that Ippon-datara attacks people, it is said that it never attacks a mailman for unknown reasons.

sen.j: 名称の「だたら」はたたら吹き（鍛冶師）に通じる。
sen.e: "Datara" of ippon datara may come from Tatara-buki (blacksmith).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Datara' of Ippon datara may have come from Tatara-buki (blacksmith).
Datara' of Ippon datara may have come from Tatara-buki (blacksmith).

sen.j: これは鍛冶師が重労働で片目と片脚が萎えること、一本だたらの出没場所が鉱山跡に近いことに関連するとの説がある（隻眼神話・伝説の中の隻眼を参照）。
sen.e: Some say because blacksmith may weaken his one eye and one leg for heavy labor, and other says because the ippon datara appears near remains of a mine (refer to the legend of a single eye/legendary single eye).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Someone says it is because in the past the heavy labor of blacksmiths had weakened their one eye and one leg; other says it is because Ippon-datara had appeared near the remains of mines (refer to myths of single eye and single eye in legends).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Someone says it is because in the past the heavy labor of blacksmiths had weakened their one eye and one leg; other says it is because Ippon-datara had appeared near the remains of mines (refer to myths of single eye and single eye in legends).

sen.j: 一つ目の鍛冶神、天目一箇神（あめのまひとつのかみ）の零落した姿であるとも考えられている。
sen.e: Some say that it is fallen Amenomahitotsu no Kami, one-eyed god of smithery.
Someone says that it is Ame no Mahitotsu no Kami, the one-eyed god of smith, who ruined himself.
Someone says that it is Ame no Mahitotsu no Kami, the one-eyed god of smith, who ruined himself.

sen.j: 2004年春には、和歌山県田辺市の富田という地域の田で1本足の足跡が発見された。
sen.e: In spring of 2004, one-legged footsteps were fond in an area called Tomida in Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In spring of 2004, one-legged footsteps were fond in an area called Tomida in Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture.
In spring of 2004, one-legged footsteps were fond in an area called Tomida in Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 「富田のがしゃんぼ」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was called "Tomita no gashanbo" (ghost with one leg).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It was called 'Tomita no Gashanbo' (ghost with one leg).
It was called 'Tomita no Gashanbo' (ghost with one leg).

sen.j: 一本だたらやかしゃんぼの復活かと話題になった。
sen.e: It became the center of attention for a possible revival of Ippon-datara or Gashanbo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It became the center of attention for a possible revival of Ippon-datara or Gashanbo.
It became the center of attention for a possible revival of Ippon-datara or Gashanbo.

sen.j: 奈良県吉野郡の松本工房では、一本だたらの伝承をもとにした民芸品「一本足だたらこけし」を2005年より販売している。
sen.e: Since 2005, a folk craft "ipponashi datara kokeshi" (limbless wooden doll of ghost with one leg), which are based on the ippon datara folklore, are sold at Matsumoto Kobo (craft center), Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Since 2005, 'Ippon-ashi-datara Kokeshi' (wooden doll of ghost with one leg), a folk craft made by referring to the folklores of Ippon-datara, is sold at Matsumoto Kobo Craft Center in Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.

Since 2005, 'Ippon-ashi-datara Kokeshi' (wooden doll of ghost with one leg), a folk craft made by referring to the folklores of Ippon-datara, is sold at Matsumoto Kobo Craft Center in Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 妖怪土産として秀逸な一品との声もある。
sen.e: Some say that it is an excellent specter shaped souvenir.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Someone says that it is an excellent souvenir as a doll in the shape of a specter.
Someone says that it is an excellent souvenir as a doll in the shape of a specter.

sen.j: また、富山県上新川郡（現・富山市）、岐阜県北部の飛騨地方、岡山県都窪郡に伝わる妖怪の雪入道（ゆきにゅうどう）も一つ目と一本足の大入道で、雪の上に30センチメートルほどの大きさの足跡を残すという。
sen.e: Moreover, yukinyudo (snow bald-headed monster), which is known in Kaminiikawa District, Toyama Prefecture (present Toyama City), Hida area of northern Gifu Prefecture and Tsukubo District, Okayama Prefecture, reportedly has one eye and one leg and leaves 30 centimeter diameter foot steps on the snow.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, in Kaminikawa County (present Toyama City) of Toyama Prefecture, and in Hida region of northern Gifu Prefecture, and in Tsukubo County of Okayama Prefecture, remain legends of Yuki-nyudo; it has been considered to be a snow monster with a bald head, and has one eye and one leg, and its footstep it leave on the snow is thirty centimeters long.
sen.cmt: 用語を統一、わかりやすくします。
sen.e: Moreover, in Kaminikawa County (present Toyama City) of Toyama Prefecture, and in Hida region of northern Gifu Prefecture, and in Tsukubo County of Okayama Prefecture, remain legends of Yuki-nyudo; it has been considered to be a snow monster with a bald head, and has one eye and one leg, and its footstep it leave on the snow is thirty centimeters long.

sen.j: しかし、一本だたらと特徴が共通することから、文献によっては同一の妖怪として混同されている。
sen.e: However, since it has same characteristics as ippon datara, they may be regarded as the same specter in some literature.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, since it has the same characteristics as Ippon-datara, they are regarded as the same and one specter in some literatures.
